data.text: Has Anybody Tried the RedShift Kitchen Sink HandleBars
Han anybody tried thes bars? they look interesting, especial to optional grips https://redshiftsports.com/products/kitchen-sink-handlebar
I'm just about to take a set off my bike, the extra grips really make sense once you've been on them a while, really liked the bottoms

data.text: They are amazing, I‘m using the bar for half a year now and they are worth any Euro. Even better to have the kitchen sink bar.

data.text: for gravel? what do you thin about them for endurance / audax
data.author: Julian Young

data.text: yes for both, using it on trail as well for rides > 200 km
data.author: Ra ELef

data.text: I considered them but trialed double handlebar taping and that worked a treat.
data.author: Brendan Sheahan

data.text: I had these on my bike for over a year. They are specially good on long rides.
data.author: Chris Freeman

data.text: Not the red sink but I do use a selcof expedition bar.the loop is super useful
data.author: Osian Piercy

data.text: nice set up, what bike and bags have you got?
data.author: Kevin Jones

data.text: thank you :) it's a 2021 Kona unit x,ortlieb frame bag, podsacs on forks and saddle. On the bars I've got a 14L dry bag mounted out front and a smaller one closer to the bars. Advantage with these bars is that you can have a larger frame bag without worrying about cables
data.author: Osian Piercy

data.text: Happy with them.
data.author: Butch Bard

data.text: I use the top grips and love them!
data.author: Craig Nightingale

data.text: Yep. Love em but I went with long ESI silicone grips for the drops. Something I hadn't seen before.
data.author: Jeff Emrich

data.text: Love mine, though I rarely use the lower ones. Would buy them again minus the bottom grips.
data.author: Devin Quince

data.text: The bottom grips make a huge difference in comfort for the same reason people like the ergo grips, really helps to manage the weight on a weaker part of your hand while keeping in an anatomical position
data.author: Brian Steven Wagner

data.text: I rode the Tour Divide with these including all my training rides leading up to the race. Best bar setup by farm zero discomfort issues.
data.author: Phil Jones

data.text: Would those grips work on regular dropbars?

data.text: yup.
